8802.bart_summary: Ogle-2014-BLG-0124Lb was detected by the Spitzer Space Telescope and the Ogle Warsaw Telescope in Chile. The planet is half as massive as Jupiter and could help astronomers gain a better understanding of the distribution of planets in the Milky Way. It was discovered using a technique known as microlensing. This happens when one star happens to pass in front of another, and its gravity acts as a lens to magnify and brighten the more distant star's light. Most of the planets we know about are around 10-100 times closer.

In 1950, they were reburied asunknowns at the National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific - also known as the Punchbowl - inside a volcanic crater in Honolulu.

9000.bart_summary: Experts from Centre for International Research in the Humanities and Social Sciences (CIRHUS) in New York City studied neolithic ornaments to understand how farming spread. They examined 200 bead-type objects found at more than 400 European sites over a 3,000-year period. Based on discoveries of different types of Neolithic or ornament, they concluded that Northern Europeans in the Neolithic period initially rejected the practice of farming. Their findings show a bump in the road in the adoption of farming, which enabled groups of people to move away from foraging and hunting as a means for survival.
